trans-unit.source: Activity 2: Run SQL using the client driver

seg-source.mrk: Activity 2: Run SQL using the client driver

target.mrk: Activity 2: Run SQL using the client driver

trans-unit.source: This activity uses <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> within a client/server configuration by using the Network Server. The <codeph>ij</codeph> tool is the client application that connects to the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server. In this activity, you create a database called <codeph>seconddb</codeph> and run some basic SQL statements.

seg-source.mrk: This activity uses <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> within a client/server configuration by using the Network Server.
The <codeph>ij</codeph> tool is the client application that connects to the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server.
In this activity, you create a database called <codeph>seconddb</codeph> and run some basic SQL statements.

target.mrk: This activity uses <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> within a client/server configuration by using the Network Server.
The <codeph>ij</codeph> tool is the client application that connects to the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server.
In this activity, you create a database called <codeph>seconddb</codeph> and run some basic SQL statements.

trans-unit.source: This activity assumes that you know how to open a command shell and change to the <codeph>DERBYTUTOR</codeph> directory.

seg-source.mrk: This activity assumes that you know how to open a command shell and change to the <codeph>DERBYTUTOR</codeph> directory.

target.mrk: This activity assumes that you know how to open a command shell and change to the <codeph>DERBYTUTOR</codeph> directory.

trans-unit.source: You use two command windows (referred to as Shell-1 and Shell-2) in this activity. You use Shell-1 to start the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server and display Network Server messages. You use Shell-2 to establish a client connection to the Network Server using <codeph>ij</codeph> and then perform some basic SQL operations.

seg-source.mrk: You use two command windows (referred to as Shell-1 and Shell-2) in this activity.
You use Shell-1 to start the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server and display Network Server messages.
You use Shell-2 to establish a client connection to the Network Server using <codeph>ij</codeph> and then perform some basic SQL operations.

target.mrk: You use two command windows (referred to as Shell-1 and Shell-2) in this activity.
You use Shell-1 to start the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> Network Server and display Network Server messages.
You use Shell-2 to establish a client connection to the Network Server using <codeph>ij</codeph> and then perform some basic SQL operations.

trans-unit.source: java -jar $DERBY_HOME/lib/derbyrun.jar server start Thu Sep 13 16:45:36 EDT 2012 : Security manager installed using the Basic server security policy. trans-unit.source: You will enter all subsequent commands from the network client, so you will type the commands in the Shell-2 command window.

seg-source.mrk: You will enter all subsequent commands from the network client, so you will type the commands in the Shell-2 command window.

target.mrk: You will enter all subsequent commands from the network client, so you will type the commands in the Shell-2 command window.

trans-unit.source: Create and open a connection to the database using the client driver.

seg-source.mrk: Create and open a connection to the database using the client driver.

target.mrk: Create and open a connection to the database using the client driver.

trans-unit.source: CONNECT 'jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/seconddb;create=true';

seg-source.mrk: CONNECT 'jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/seconddb;create=true';

target.mrk: CONNECT 'jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/seconddb;create=true';

trans-unit.source: A client connection URL contains a hostname and a port number. For example: <codeph>//localhost:1527/</codeph>

seg-source.mrk: A client connection URL contains a hostname and a port number.
For example: <codeph>//localhost:1527/</codeph>

target.mrk: A client connection URL contains a hostname and a port number.
For example: <codeph>//localhost:1527/</codeph>

trans-unit.source: Create a table with two columns (ID and NAME) using the following SQL statement:

seg-source.mrk: Create a table with two columns (ID and NAME) using the following SQL statement:

target.mrk: Create a table with two columns (ID and NAME) using the following SQL statement:

trans-unit.source: CREATE TABLE SECONDTABLE (ID INT PRIMARY KEY, NAME VARCHAR(14)); 0 rows inserted/updated/deleted

seg-source.mrk: CREATE TABLE SECONDTABLE (ID INT PRIMARY KEY, NAME VARCHAR(14)); 0 rows inserted/updated/deleted

target.mrk: CREATE TABLE SECONDTABLE (ID INT PRIMARY KEY, NAME VARCHAR(14)); 0 rows inserted/updated/deleted

trans-unit.source: Insert three records into the table.

seg-source.mrk: Insert three records into the table.

target.mrk: Insert three records into the table.

trans-unit.source: INSERT INTO SECONDTABLE VALUES (100,'ONE HUNDRED'),(200,'TWO HUNDRED'),(300,'THREE HUNDRED'); 3 rows inserted/updated/deleted

seg-source.mrk: INSERT INTO SECONDTABLE VALUES (100,'ONE HUNDRED'),(200,'TWO HUNDRED'),(300,'THREE HUNDRED'); 3 rows inserted/updated/deleted

target.mrk: INSERT INTO SECONDTABLE VALUES (100,'ONE HUNDRED'),(200,'TWO HUNDRED'),(300,'THREE HUNDRED'); 3 rows inserted/updated/deleted

trans-unit.source: Select all of the records in the table.

seg-source.mrk: Select all of the records in the table.

target.mrk: Select all of the records in the table.

trans-unit.source: SELECT * FROM SECONDTABLE; ID |NAME ------------------------ 100 |ONE HUNDRED 200 |TWO HUNDRED 300 |THREE HUNDRED 3 rows selected

seg-source.mrk: SELECT * FROM SECONDTABLE; ID |NAME ------------------------ 100 |ONE HUNDRED 200 |TWO HUNDRED 300 |THREE HUNDRED 3 rows selected

target.mrk: SELECT * FROM SECONDTABLE; ID |NAME ------------------------ 100 |ONE HUNDRED 200 |TWO HUNDRED 300 |THREE HUNDRED 3 rows selected

trans-unit.source: Select a subset of records from the table by specifying a <codeph>WHERE</codeph> clause.

seg-source.mrk: Select a subset of records from the table by specifying a <codeph>WHERE</codeph> clause.

target.mrk: Select a subset of records from the table by specifying a <codeph>WHERE</codeph> clause.

trans-unit.source: SELECT * FROM SECONDTABLE WHERE ID=200; ID |NAME ------------------------ 200 |TWO HUNDRED 1 row selected

seg-source.mrk: SELECT * FROM SECONDTABLE WHERE ID=200; ID |NAME ------------------------ 200 |TWO HUNDRED 1 row selected

target.mrk: SELECT * FROM SECONDTABLE WHERE ID=200; ID |NAME ------------------------ 200 |TWO HUNDRED 1 row selected

trans-unit.source: Exit <codeph>ij</codeph>.

seg-source.mrk: Exit <codeph>ij</codeph>.

target.mrk: Exit <codeph>ij</codeph>.

trans-unit.source: exit;

seg-source.mrk: exit;

target.mrk: exit;

trans-unit.source: Activity notes

seg-source.mrk: Activity notes

target.mrk: Activity notes

trans-unit.source: The client connection URL contains network information (hostname and portnumber) not found in the URL for an embedded connection. This information tells the client driver the location of the Network Server. The client driver sends requests to and receives responses from the Network Server.

seg-source.mrk: The client connection URL contains network information (hostname and portnumber) not found in the URL for an embedded connection.
This information tells the client driver the location of the Network Server.
The client driver sends requests to and receives responses from the Network Server.

target.mrk: The client connection URL contains network information (hostname and portnumber) not found in the URL for an embedded connection.
This information tells the client driver the location of the Network Server.
The client driver sends requests to and receives responses from the Network Server.

trans-unit.source: In this activity the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database engine is embedded in the Network Server and returns data to the <codeph>ij</codeph> client (a client/server configuration). In contrast, establishing a connection using an embedded URL (one without <codeph>//localhost:1527/</codeph>) would have caused the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> engine to be embedded in the <codeph>ij</codeph> application (an embedded configuration).

seg-source.mrk: In this activity the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database engine is embedded in the Network Server and returns data to the <codeph>ij</codeph> client (a client/server configuration).

In contrast, establishing a connection using an embedded URL (one without <codeph>//localhost:1527/</codeph>) would have caused the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> engine to be embedded in the <codeph>ij</codeph> application (an embedded configuration).

target.mrk: In this activity the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database engine is embedded in the Network Server and returns data to the <codeph>ij</codeph> client (a client/server configuration).

In contrast, establishing a connection using an embedded URL (one without <codeph>//localhost:1527/</codeph>) would have caused the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> engine to be embedded in the <codeph>ij</codeph> application (an embedded configuration).

trans-unit.source: In this configuration, multiple client programs can connect to the Network Server and access the database simultaneously. (This activity does not demonstrate this capability.)

seg-source.mrk: In this configuration, multiple client programs can connect to the Network Server and access the database simultaneously.
(This activity does not demonstrate this capability.)

target.mrk: In this configuration, multiple client programs can connect to the Network Server and access the database simultaneously.
(This activity does not demonstrate this capability.)
